description: Niger will close public schools from December 17 to January 1, 2021, with all workshops and seminars being banned during this period. UPDATE: The original policy was that in Niger all schools were closed for at least two weeks starting from March 20th. This was updated to Niger opening schools on 1 June and then Niger reopening schools and resuming classes on June 1. Public schools will now close from December 17 through January 1, 2021 with all workshops and seminars being banned.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type_sub_cat: Preschool or childcare facilities (generally for children ages 5 and below)
institution_status: Preschool or childcare facilities closed/locked down
compliance: Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

description: Niger announces state of health emergency throughout the national territory as of 27 March. As of October 10, Niger announced an extension of the state of health emergency throughout the national territory until January 10. UPDATE: The declaration of emergency was announced throughout the national territory as of March 27. As of October 10, the declaration of emergency has been extended for three months.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time)

description: Land borders in Niger have been closed since March 19, however, merchandise and passengers with special permission are exempt.

compliance: Mandatory (Unspecified/Implied)

description: Niger State Task Force on Covid-19 and the Secretary of the Government stated that as of April 29th, everyone, even those eligible to cross, into the State will be examined and screened thoroughly by medical personnel.

description: Niger announces the closure of railway stations and suspension of public ground transport for a period of one week, renewable from 21 March. As of May 14, the ban on intercity travel in Niger has ended. UPDATE: The original internal border restrictions were set to last for a period of one week, renewable from March 21. One May 14, the ban on intercity travel was lifted.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more countries and one or more regional groupings
compliance: Mandatory (Unspecified/Implied)

description: Niger is planning on launching a country-wide food and cash distribution operation for all the families affected by the restrictions on the Transport sector. This operation will concern 4,054 households, or 28,376 beneficiary people, over a period of five months, starting May 5th.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type_text: The policy refers to the economical aspect of the country and isn't related to restrictions on sectors or lockdowns. This policy has to do with the financial relief policies that Niger is beginning to implement on specific groups of people.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
compliance: Voluntary/Recommended but No Penalties

description: Niger has banned all gatherings with at least 1,000 people UPDATE: March 13 gatherings with at least 1,000 people were prohibited
